headline: SBA Communications raises annual revenue forecast on robust wireless carrier activity
summary: Mobile network operators have increased investments in cell towers as they ramp up 5G and network infrastructure to capitalize on growing mobile demand, benefiting SBA.  "New U.S. leasing business signed up during the quarter was ahead of our expectations and benefited from continued high levels of new colocations," said CEO Brendan Cavanagh.  SBA is seeing new U.S. leasing business coming more from new lease agreements than from the modification of existing leases.

SBA is seeing new U.S. leasing business coming more from new lease agreements than from the modification of existing leases.

headline: RingCentral (RNG) Shares Skyrocket, What You Need To Know
summary: Shares of office and call centre communications software provider RingCentral (NYSE:RNG) jumped 6.6% in the after-market session after the company announced an expanded partnership with AT&T, amid a broader rally in software stocks.

headline: AT&T Surges 46.8% in a Year: Should T Stock Be in Your Portfolio?
summary: With 243K fiber adds in the second quarter and a 46.8% surge, T is charging ahead, yet market saturation and stiff competition could test its momentum.

headline: LegisIQ Debuts AI‑Powered Legislative Intelligence Platform
summary: LegisIQ today launched its next‑generation platform that tracks, analyzes, and alerts on legislation in all 50 states. Founded GovTech entrepreneur William Fish, LegisIQ builds on the unprecedented growth of Louisiana's Legiscon, following the launch of their AI suite in 2024.

headline: NYSE names public policy veteran Bryan Daniel as president of NYSE Texas
summary: His background in public policy could be key as NYSE works to strengthen its presence in a state that hosts the largest number of companies listed on the exchange.  Daniel is the chair of the Texas Workforce Commission, which oversees and provides workforce development services to employers and job seekers of the Lone Star State.

headline: Cash Windfall From Trump’s Tax Law Is Starting to Show Up at Big Companies
summary: The magnitude of the cash savings from this summer’s federal tax legislation is starting to take shape at America’s biggest companies.  AT&T  recently said it expected $1.5 billion to $2 billion in cash tax savings this year, due to provisions in the tax-and-spending law dubbed the One Big Beautiful Bill Act.  The high end of the range is equivalent to an 11% boost to analyst estimates of 2025 free cash flow before the law was enacted.
